chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Charlie L. Mack Jr. was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $5,000.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  Maintain stable residence.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  
Count 1 - Total length of sentence:  4.5 years.
Initial term of confinement:  1.5 years WSP, credit for 113 days served.
Length of extended supervision:  3 years w/conditions.  Conditions include payment of a fine of $5,000.00 + costs.
Def. is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Driving privileges revoked for 36 months.  Ignition interlock ordered.  Alcohol assessment ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.  $1,000.00 cash bond to be applied to financial obligations.
from WCS.  WCS has had no contact with def. since he was placed in custody on 2/3/16.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Celebre.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from WCS.  WCS has had no contact with def. since he was placed in custody on 2/3/16.

346.63(1)(a) - OWI 4th   343.44(1)(b) - OAR   346.63(1)(b) - PAC 4th

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. has been non-complinant with WCS and bond conditions by consuming alcohol.  Bail jumping charges that have been issued in 16CF94.  State requests bond amount be increased.  Defense requests bond not be changed.  Court raises bond amount to $2,500.00 cash w/same conditions.  Def. has $1,000.00 cash bond posted; must post an additional $1,500.00 by 5:00 PM today or report to Public Safety Building.  Case remains on for JSH 2/18/16 at 1:00 and JT on 2/22/16 at 8:30.  State indicates they will be filing a motion to join this case with 16CF94.
from WCS.  Def. is in compliance but is not enrolled in any treatment program.
Bail/bond hearing at 02-03-2016 10:40 am
from WCS.  Def. has been non-compliant by consuming alcohol.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty David Celebre.  Matt Reihling of WCS appeared.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  The WCS office closest to Madison is in Jefferson Co.  Def. requests he be placed in the SCRAM program by WCS; that decision to be made by WCS.  No bond modification necessary.  JSH 2/18/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 2/22/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
Amended

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  State's motion to amend the Information is granted.  Amended Information filed.  Plea of not guity entered by def.  Defense motion to modify bond condition heard.  Def. would like to relocate to Madison and requests bond condition re reporting to WCS be removed.  Hearing adj. to 12/18/15 at 8:45 to allow Atty Celebre time to see if there are similar reporting facilities in Madison.  Bond continued.
